snippet: Lt. Gen. James L. Terry, the new leader of the military joint command, said the shake-up in Afghanistan’s security leadership would not derail the transfer of authority to Afghan forces.
abstract: Lt Gen James L Terry, American leader of the international joint command in Afghanistan, insists allied forces will not let the shake-up in two critical security ministries derail the transfer of authority to Afghan forces; he is first to publicly address dismissal of Defense Minister Abdul Rahim Wardak and Interior Minister Bismillah Khan Mohammadi.
lead_paragraph: Lt. Gen. James L. Terry, the new leader of the military joint command, said the shake-up in Afghanistan’s security leadership would not derail the transfer of authority to Afghan forces.

headline.seo: U.S. General Sees Little Change in Dismissal of Afghan Ministers
headline.main: Afghan Transfer on Pace After Firings, General Says
headline.print_headline: Afghan Transfer on Pace After Firings, General Says

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
